title: Move to "Inbox" Again - Logic is unclear
content:
When right-clicking on an email (RMB), I see the option "Move to Inbox Again." However, the logic behind this option is unclear.

I've noticed that some emails initially arrive in my unified inbox (due to multiple accounts being set up), but after some time—perhaps up to a day—they are moved to the Junk folder. This behavior started around six months ago. I've been using Thunderbird for a long time and regularly update it, so this issue is relatively recent and quite noticeable.

Previously, the "Move to Inbox Again" option was useful for retrieving legitimate emails that were wrongly marked as junk. I would open the Junk folder, highlight the non-junk emails, right-click, and select the option. Thunderbird would then move each email back to its respective account's inbox, as expected.

However, recently I've noticed that when multiple emails are selected, they are all moved to the inbox of the first accountlisted among the selected messages, rather than returning to their original inboxes. This is a clear deviation from the previous behavior and leads to confusion and misplacement of messages.

Additionally, this option appears even when an email is already in the inbox. In such cases, selecting "Move to Inbox Again" moves the email to the default account's inbox, which doesn’t make much sense. In my opinion, this option should either be disabled or removed when the email is already in an inbox folder.

title: Errore di invio
content: Salve, da alcuni giorni non riesco ad inviare mail da un account di posta con Thunderbird (ne ho un altro che funziona correttamente). All' invio del messaggio apre un popup con questa dicitura: "Invio del messaggio non riuscito. Si è verificato un errore durante l’invio della posta. Il server di posta ha risposto: jhzWuLHlRt6p9jhzWu1reb spam content detected. Controllare il messaggio e riprovare." Ho contattato il gestore del servizio (Aruba) e a loro risulta tutto ok, il dominio e la mail non sono in nessuna black list, anche l'indirizzo IP è ok. I parametri per il server di posta in uscita sono corretti. Ho eliminato la firma nel messaggio. Riesco ad inviare le mail dalla webmail e da un programma di posta che ho sul telefono. Ho pensato di eliminare l'account e reimpostarlo, perchè in Imap, ma ho paura di perdere qualche mail importante. Spero possiate aiutarmi. Grazie Riccardo

Is there anything that can be done to stop this?

title: Thunderbird (Windows v141.0) 8k Inbox/folder size, not syncing with Yahoo Webmail (new folder)
content:
Hi there,

I'm starting to using Thunderbird (v141.0) in Windows 10 Pro to see my Yahoo emails.

I configured Thunderbird using IMAP setup.

I'm seeing 2 issues:

1. Initial sync: Thunderbird can see all the folders. It synced all the mails with a limitation that it could only sync about 8k mails into the Inbox and folders, and stopped afterward (my Yahoo Inbox has over 10K mails).


2. After the initial sync, Thunderbird can see and sync new emails in the Inbox. However, it cannot see new folders on the Yahoo email account.

I moved about 8k mails in my Yahoo webmail from its Inbox into a new folder created in Yahoo webmail.

It has been over 16 hours. I am not seeing the newly created folder showing up in the Thunderbird App in Windows.

I tried modifying the name of an existing folder in Yahoo Webmail. It's been 2 hours. That change isn't reflected in Thunderbird App (Windows v141.0) either.

3. It seems it's syncing emails with the Yahoo mail server quite a bit slowly (compared to Outlook Classic in Windows) - like 0.8 sec per mail message. For a large Inbox/folder size, this takes a long time to sync.


Thanks.

title: Only 1 gmail account doesn't work on Thunderbird-walking through each step of the troubleshooting doesn't work-help!
content:
I have multiple gmail accounts set up on Thunderbird. They were all working fine until I traveled overseas and came back. Then, all of a sudden, 1 gmail account stopped working. The rest kept working fine. I checked the settings and they were correct. I removed the account and tried to set it up again (about 10 times), but kept getting the same error message: "Unable to log in at server. Probably wrong configuration, username or password." The automatic configuration passed and I even tried manually configuring to the recommended settings to no avail.

The only thing I can think of is that when traveling overseas and trying to get online, Thunderbird and/or Gmail asks for further security verification, and I just avoided using Thunderbird altogether while abroad. Upon my return, I started getting this error message. It is extremely inconvenient to have to use the Gmail interface for only 1 email (my main email!). Does anybody know anything I can do to repair this? I'm almost tempted to use another email client altogether to make my life more efficient as the new setup is not sustainable.

title: E-mail Settings and Auto Refill
content:
I think I have two issues: 1: When I tried to send an e-mail to seller on Craigslist, the auto-populate used an old, obsolete e-mail address. I do have things saved from that e-mail, but I went into address book and deleted that address and also went into Firefox setting to autofill, though it only had home address not e-mail address. I also went to Firefox to delete something else that the internet said to delete so autofill would stop with old address.

Problem 2: In my Thunderbird e-mail I do have three e-mails that show, one for normal, one for junk, and the old one. The old one has a yellow star by it. I have old emails I like to look back on but maybe it would just be easier to delete the whole thing. Because when I tried to send an email to the seller, it still populated the old address (though I changed the name on the card, thinking I could fool it). So now in just has the word discontinued in the TO: line. I would like to keep this old e-mail information, but ditch the e-mail address and make my g-mail the default. I didn't know how to do that. I'm assuming that's what the star is in the tree by the three email addresses (the yellow star is on the obsolete e-mail, which I assume is why it auto populates that one). Is there a way to ditch that e-mail address of gunnyandburlap but keep the e-mails in that account? And what did I not do right to get it out of the auto-fill on the TO: line of the new e-mail I tried to send? I thought I was doing well to delete it from all my address books, but that didn't do it.

I would appreciate any help you could give me. I do better if you give me a 1. 2. 3. approach, as I'm old. Thank you. N.H.

I'm having trouble with the Outgoing Server settings in TB- mail sent from MyName@ is sent and received normally, but when the recipient replies, it goes to Info@. When I tried changing this in Account Settings>Edit Outgoing Server (specifying 'MyName@ as the User Name), it applies this same User Name to the Info@ Outgoing Server settings. And vice versa- if I change the Info@ Outgoing Server settings, it applies this back to the MyName@ Outgoing Server settings again.

I tried using 'Manage Identities' in Account Settings, creating an Info@ Identity, but this doesn't fix the problem. Help would be appreciated.
